solution_line_template: Book 1 was ${book1_price} and book 2 was ${book2_price} so {book1_price} +{book2_price} = ${first_two_total}
He was buying 4 books, so these 2 were {discount_percent*100}% off so {first_two_total} * {discount_percent} = ${discount_amount}
These two books came out to {first_two_total}-{discount_amount} = $<<{first_two_total}-{discount_amount}={discounted_first_two_total}>>{discounted_first_two_total}
When you add all 4 books together, {discounted_first_two_total}+{last_two_total} = $<<{discounted_first_two_total}+{last_two_total}={total_books_cost}>>{total_books_cost}
To get free shipping he would need to spend {free_shipping_threshold}-{total_books_cost} = $<<{free_shipping_threshold}-{total_books_cost}={additional_needed}>>{additional_needed} more on books
